text:
I think this should go in as a doc clarification, but I am filing in bugzilla 
for completeness. That wierd little JVM from MS, fast as it was at the time, 
doesnt like -classpath (-cp is ok), or any means of speccing the max memory. 

So the <java> task as is wont spawn jview.exe reliably, even if you name the 
command properly. The fact that nobody has mentioned this is a good thing: it 
means no ant users use the MSJVM. but we should document it in a) system 
requirements and b) the java task. Or we could hack around the CommandLineJava 
stuff, but I would rather leave that to someone who actually wants to run 
jview.

I am willing to do the doc changes.
creator: steve_l@iseran.com

text:
I am closing this as wontfix now that the docs are changed. 

It is still nominally possible to modify <java> to generate the subset of 
params that jview takes, but I dont see the point if nobody is using it. 
Likewise for regression testing the whole of ant on jview itself.
